title: I am a google pixel lover, and would like to help developing the google phone experience!
content:
I had made a post complaining about how my Pixel XL's battery performance was bad, but i investigated the issue on my own and came up with this conclusion i think this may help all of us!
So i noticed that the pixel "shutting off" issue is caused by the battery's temperature. lithium batteries are known for having poor performance issues in the cold, and i noticed that when i keep my phone warm (30c+) it can go all the way down to 5% battery before "shutting down", and if my phone is cold (below 20c) the battery "gives up" and shuts down around 30~50% battery indicator. 

TIP: Keep your old google pixel in your pocket or near your skin in cold weather because the heat will help the battery last longer! :D

As far as i know this probably affects most modern battery packs based off Li-Ion tech, so as a general rule of thumb it's good to keep them lioon battery packs "warm"!
Is there a way i could get more involved in making the pixel experience even better than it already is?
